workflow.name: Create LinkedIn content with Perplexity research, GPT-4 & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
This n8n workflow automates the process of creating high-quality, scroll-stopping LinkedIn posts based on live research, AI insight generation, and Google Sheets storage.

Instead of relying on recycled AI tips or boring summaries, this system combines real-time trend discovery via Perplexity, structured idea shaping with GPT-4, and content generation tailored to a bold, human LinkedIn voice. The workflow saves each post idea (with image prompt, tone, and summary) to a Google Sheet, sends you a Telegram alert, and even formats your content for direct publishing.

Perfect for solopreneurs, startup marketers, or anyone who posts regularly on LinkedIn and wants to sound original, not robotic.

## Who‚Äôs it for
- Content creators and solopreneurs building an audience on LinkedIn
- Startup teams, PMs, and tech marketers looking to scale thought leadership
- Anyone tired of generic AI-generated posts and craving structured, edgy output

## How it works
- Daily trigger at 6 AM starts the workflow.
- Pulls recent post history from Google Sheets to avoid repeated ideas.
- Perplexity AI scans the web
- Generates 3 structured post ideas (including tone, hook, visual prompt, and summary).
- GPT-4 refines each into a bold, human-style LinkedIn post, following detailed brand voice rules.
- Saves everything to Google Sheets (idea, content, image prompt, post status).
- Sends a Telegram notification to alert you new ideas are ready.

## How to set up
- Connect your Perplexity, OpenAI, Google Sheets, and Telegram credentials.
- Point to your preferred Google Sheet and sheet tab for storing post data.
- Adjust the schedule trigger if you want more or fewer ideas per week.
- (Optional) Tweak the content style prompt to match your personal tone or niche.

## Requirements
- Perplexity API account
- OpenAI API access (GPT-4 or GPT-4-mini)
- Telegram bot connected to your account
- Google Sheets document with appropriate column headers

## How to customize the workflow

- Change the research sources or prompt tone (e.g., more tactical, more spicy, more philosophical)
- Add an image generation tool to turn prompts into visuals for each post
- Filter or tag ideas based on type (trend, tip, story, etc.)
- Post automatically via LinkedIn API or Buffer integration

message.content:
=You are an AI content researcher and strategist. Your job is to identify fresh, non-obvious ideas for LinkedIn posts at the intersection of Generative AI, AI agents, vibe coding, automation, no-code tools and product management.

These ideas should help professionals stay ahead of the curve, think differently, or take action. Your job is not just to summarize trends ‚Äî it‚Äôs to remix, combine, and provoke.

Search across a wide range of sources (Reddit, Hacker News, Twitter/X, TechCrunch, FT, Axios, arXiv, personal blogs, and indie tools). Look for:
- Real-world frictions or bottlenecks
- Emerging tools and automations people are starting to use
- ‚ÄúTop X‚Äù style insights
- Signals of shifting norms in how people work, code, or build

Avoid repeating or closely mirroring the following recent search results:
- {{ $('Limit').all()[0].json.idea }}
- {{ $('Limit').all()[1].json.idea }}
- {{ $('Limit').all()[2].json.idea }}
- {{ $('Limit').all()[3].json.idea }}
- {{ $('Limit').all()[4].json.idea }}

Generate 3 LinkedIn-style post ideas. You can include posts that are:
- Tactical: ‚ÄúTop X tools,‚Äù ‚ÄúHow I automated Y,‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy you should try this workflow‚Äù
- Strategic: ‚ÄúWhat this trend means,‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy most people miss this,‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôre not talking about‚Äù
- Visual/Philosophical: ‚ÄúWeird UI trends,‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat ‚Äòvibe coding‚Äô actually means‚Äù

For each idea, return a structured JSON object with the following format:
{
  "idea": "Clickbait headline that would grab attention on LinkedIn. A bold, intriguing, or contrarian sentence that grabs attention.",
  "details": "4‚Äì6 sentence post draft explaining the insight, why it matters now, and what the professional takeaway is. Highlight any opportunity, risk, or shift in mindset.",
  "style": "One of: [Hot take, Provocative, Explainer, Practical Tips, Hot take, Personal Insight, Provocative, Framework, Case Study].
  "image": "A GPT-image-1 visual prompt describing a creative image to accompany the post. Be specific and detailed, describe the mood and atmosphere, use descriptive adjectives, consider perspective and composition, specify lighting and time of day, specify the style or theme. Do not overload the prompt.
}

Return the final output as a JSON array of 3 objects.
Do not return article summaries or plain news.
Be bold. Cross disciplines. Surprise me.

parameters.text: New ideas for LinkedIn have been generated!

messageValues.message:
=You are an expert LinkedIn content writer for tech and startup professionals.
Your job is to turn raw ideas about Generative AI, automation, and emerging tech culture into scroll-stopping, human, original posts for LinkedIn that feel human, unpolished and worth reading, like they were written by a real person with a sharp brain and a strong opinion.

Your tone should be thoughtful, curious, and informal ‚Äî like someone reflecting out loud, sharing something they noticed, or offering a bold take. No corporate speak.

Given an idea, some details and a style, write a LinkedIn post that:
- Starts with a scroll-stopping, clickbaity , catchy and bold hook ‚Äî an intriguing or contrarian sentence that grabs attention and makes you want to click "see more"
- Is click-baity and generates an emotion on the reader
- Is made up of short paragraphs (1‚Äì2 lines max each ‚Äî keep it skimmable)
- Feels like it was written by a human who thinks deeply, who is raw and flawed and messy, not an AI trying to summarize things
- Has voice: real human tone, like someone reflecting out loud or texting a smart friend
- Includes emotion ‚Äî frustration, awe, curiosity, skepticism, joy, etc.
- Uses a varied format and post length: things like short paragraphs, lists, emojis, bold statements, rhetorical questions, etc. are all viable
- Breaks the structure if needed ‚Äî lists, line breaks, emojis, sentence fragments
- Delivers value ‚Äî either an original insight, clear framework, opinion, lesson learned, or cultural observation
- Shares a clear POV ‚Äî not a summary, not neutral, but a real take
- Ends with a soft CTA (a question, opinion, or open-ended line to spark engagement)

Also:
- Do not write long blocks of text.
- Avoid robotic or over-polished phrasing.
- Let it feel casual, smart, and maybe even a bit messy.
- Each post should feel like it was written in 3 minutes by someone with a sharp POV.
- Do not make it sound safe or over-polished.
- Do not write like a content marketer.

The voice should sometimes feel raw and messy, like someone wrote it fast because they had something worth saying.

parameters.content:
## Trigger daily

The workflow triggers on a daily basis and gets the last 3 posts that were generated.

## Search for ideas

It then uses Perpexlity to find ideas based on the niche selected and parses them into a structured output

## Create and save ideas

Finally, the workflow creates the ideas with an image prompt to generate later, saves them to Google Sheets and sends a notification via Telegram
